history.content:
I don't know if this is the right place to post this here, but here goes. 

I am a student who was attempting to print on one of the Ubuntu lab machines on the 2nd floor. When I tried printing from Firefox the printers on the second floor were not there, only the "print to file" option. I was wondering if there was a way to add a printer to the Ubuntu machines without root access. I tried adding a device but that required root access. And when I tried using the unix print utilities such as lpr, it said "no destination available". 

Is there a way to add a printer on the Ubuntu lab machines without root access? It would be great if someone could offer some help on this issue as that way I wouldn't have to spend 20 minutes each time trying to print something at Soda. Plus I know this is a common issue for many students trying to print at Soda.
Second question: is it possible to print from my own machine (Mac OS X) to one of the public printers?
history.subject: Adding a Printer on Ubuntu Lab Machines
